definition: to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: Yes, Ananova, the world's first "virtual" newsreader .
sentences.chinese: 是的，愛諾娃，世界上第一個“虛擬”新聞廣播員。

sentences.english: A radio announcer may have an audience of millions.
sentences.chinese: 一個廣播員可能擁有數百萬名聽衆。

sentences.english: In the industrial model of student mass production, the teacher is the broadcaster.
sentences.chinese: 在學生大規模生產的工業模型中，教師是廣播員。

sentences.english: As I exited the water, the announcer was boisterously calling out all our names.
sentences.chinese: 當我離開水面時，廣播員正大聲喊着我們的名字。

sentences.english: He complained about BBC announcers eliding their words.
sentences.chinese: 他抱怨着BBC的廣播員刪去了他們的字句。

sentences.english: The ability to be clearly heard is extremely important for newsreaders.
sentences.chinese: 聲音宏亮清晰對新聞廣播員來說極爲重要。
